meanings.definition: To cheer for or support a team or person
meanings.sent1: I love rooting for my favorite team during the game.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys rooting for her friends when they compete.
meanings.sent3: Rooting for your team can make the game more exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her loud cheering was like rooting for a tree to grow stronger.
meanings.sent5: The fans were passionately rooting for their team to win the championship.

meanings.definition: To search for something by digging in the ground
meanings.sent1: The pig was rooting in the mud for truffles.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel was rooting around in the garden for acorns.
meanings.sent3: Rooting for buried treasure can be a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: The dog was rooting in the yard as if searching for hidden bones.
meanings.sent5: The farmer was rooting in the soil for fresh potatoes to harvest.

meanings.sent1: They are rooting their beliefs in strong values.
meanings.sent2: The community is rooting its traditions in long-standing customs.
meanings.sent3: Rooting a tree firmly in the ground ensures its stability.
meanings.sent4: The foundation of the building was rooted deeply in the bedrock.
meanings.sent5: The friendship was rooted in trust and mutual respect.
